events.originalText: Dissident Irish republican campaign: Two off-duty British Army soldiers were shot dead by Real IRA paramilitaries outside Massereene Barracks in Antrim, Northern Ireland.
events.subtitle: Dissident Irish republican campaign
events.headline: Two British Army soldiers shot dead by Real IRA paramilitaries in Antrim, Northern Ireland

events.originalText: The Kepler space telescope (depicted), designed to discover Earth-like planets orbiting other stars, was launched.
events.subtitle: Kepler space telescope
events.headline: Kepler space telescope launched to discover Earth-like planets

events.originalText: The charity single "We Are the World" by the supergroup USA for Africa was released, and went on to sell more than 20 million copies.
events.subtitle: Charity record
events.headline: Charity single 'We Are the World' by USA for Africa released, sells over 20 million copies

events.originalText: Vietnam War: The United States and South Vietnam began Operation Truong Cong Dinh to sweep the area surrounding the Mekong Delta town of Mỹ Tho to root out Viet Cong forces in the area.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: US and South Vietnam begin Operation Truong Cong Dinh in Mekong Delta town of Mỹ Tho

events.originalText: Unarmed civil rights activists marching from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama, were attacked by police on "Bloody Sunday".
events.subtitle: Civil rights movement
events.headline: Civil rights activists attacked by police on 'Bloody Sunday' in Alabama

events.originalText: World War II: At the beginning of the Battle of Remagen, Allied forces unexpectedly captured the Ludendorff Bridge, which possibly hastened the war's conclusion.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allied forces capture Ludendorff Bridge at Battle of Remagen in WWII

events.originalText: The German submarine U-47, one of the most successful U-boats of World War II, disappeared with 45 men on board.
events.subtitle: German submarine U-47 (1938)
events.headline: German submarine U-47 disappears with 45 men on board

events.originalText: Nazi German forces re-occupied the demilitarized Rhineland, violating both the Treaty of Versailles and the Locarno Treaties that were signed after World War I.
events.subtitle: Remilitarisation of the Rhineland
events.headline: Nazi German forces re-occupy demilitarized Rhineland, violating treaties

events.originalText: The German ocean liner SS Kaiser Wilhelm der Grosse became the first ship to send a wireless telegraph message to an onshore receiver.
events.subtitle: Ocean liner
events.headline: SS Kaiser Wilhelm der Grosse sends first wireless telegraph message

events.originalText: José Paranhos, Viscount of Rio Branco, began a four-year premiership as Prime Minister of the Empire of Brazil, the longest in the state's history.
events.subtitle: José Paranhos, Viscount of Rio Branco
events.headline: Viscount of Rio Branco becomes Prime Minister of Empire of Brazil

events.originalText: United States senator Daniel Webster delivered a speech advocating compromise on slavery, which proved to be unpopular with abolitionists in his home state.
events.subtitle: Daniel Webster
events.headline: Senator Daniel Webster advocates compromise on slavery in unpopular speech

events.originalText: War of the Sixth Coalition: Napoleon's army forced Mikhail Semyonovich Vorontsov's Russian troops to withdraw from the Chemin des Dames, but French casualties exceeded Russian losses.
events.subtitle: War of the Sixth Coalition
events.headline: Napoleon's army forces Russian troops to withdraw in War of the Sixth Coalition

events.originalText: A peace treaty brought the Ottoman–Venetian War to an end, ceding Cyprus from the Republic of Venice to the Ottoman Empire.
events.subtitle: Ottoman–Venetian War (1570–1573)
events.headline: Peace treaty ends Ottoman–Venetian War, ceding Cyprus to Ottoman Empire

events.originalText: Bishop Étienne Tempier promulgated a condemnation of 219 heretical propositions that were being discussed at the University of Paris.
events.subtitle: Étienne Tempier
events.headline: Bishop Tempier condemns 219 heretical propositions at University of Paris

events.originalText: Emperor Constantine I decreed that Sunday, the day honoring the sun god Sol Invictus (disc pictured), would be the Roman day of rest.
events.subtitle: Constantine the Great
events.headline: Emperor Constantine I decrees Sunday as Roman day of rest honoring Sol Invictus
